item.title: Extremely uneven ground causing falls in high traffic area with children, 6th December
item.description:
The path outside Pickhurst Infants leading upto the gate is incredibly uneven and dangerous. My own daughter has tripped up and injured herself and I have seen atleast two other children trip up in the same spot. It needs to be levelled out and fixed as soon as possible please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickhurst Green, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In front of Orientalist, 6th December
item.description:
New piece of tarmac has sunk and all vehicles drive over it making a lot of noise. Has to be dangerous for cyclists too as it's difficult to see. Other pothole just at the entrance of Sanderson Close too. Time to fix that entire road for good. Please treat this as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53-79, Highgate Road, Kentish Town, Greater London

item.title: Pathway to the park keep flooding, 6th December
item.description:
The Y Buildings have recently been converted into flats. The council are apparently considering buying them. But please be aware that these two buildings have been built on part of a moat that was filled in a few years ago. Now the buildings have been converted into apartments, the builders have built a huge soak away into this part of the medieval moat. As you can see, now itâ€™s been raining, the area is starting to flood and water pouring onto the pathway that leads to the park. I am further concerned that tax payers money will be wasted fixing all the flooding issues if Bromley Council buy these buildings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rafford Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
